result.execSummary:
Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

charges.descr: Operating While Revoked (Rev due to alc/contr subst/refusal)

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. KYLE JAMES BREY

records.addlTxt:
21CF367: Preliminary Hearing waived
Information to be filed. 
Defendant informed of charges and penalties. 
Defendant Advised of Constitutional Rights. 
Acknowledges prior conviction(s). 
21CF367 - Cts. 1 (meth) & 3(RCS): Defendant enters no contest plea. 
Factual basis and probable cause found. 
Court accepts pleas as voluntarily, knowingly and intelligently made and finds defendant guilty. 
Court orders:
 
Ct. 1: 
S/W - 3 years probation
Absolute sobriety
No intoxicants
No drink/drugs/Rx/bars/para/shot/noact
Any counseling
$518

Ct. 3:
S/w - 1 year probation (4 days credit if revoked)
45 days jail - stayed for 18 months pending completion of community service
$1,744 + $36.40
24 month DL revocation
AODA & DSP
12 months IID - 1/2 price approved
75 hours community service to be completed within 18 months.


22CF117 & 22CF120 DRI

11:19 AM Prosecuting attorney Roy La Barton Gay in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant KYLE JAMES BREY appeared by video, in custody in Priece COunty.  Attorney Kirby Daniel Harless in court for KYLE JAMES BREY. 
21CF367, 22CF117 & 22CF120
Defendant waives personal appearance.

records.addlTxt:
11:13 AM Attorney Kirby Daniel Harless in court.  Roy La Barton Gay appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
22CF117, 22CF120, 21CF367. Defendant has been transported and is in custody out of county.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for March 3, 2022 at 03:15 pm.  Initial appearance scheduled for March 30, 2022 at 11:00 am.

Defendant shall not possess any drug paraphernalia.
Defendant shall not possess any syringes unless medically required.
Not to possess or consume any illegal drugs.
Not to possess or consume any prescription drugs not prescribed.
 Not to associate with anyone involved in illegal drug activities.
Not to possess or consume any alcohol.
Not to go on any premises where primary purpose is the sale of alcohol.

Defendant KYLE JAMES BREY in court with Attorney Kirby Daniel Harless.  Defendant KYLE JAMES BREY in custody.  Lawrence Jean Broeren appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  KYLE JAMES BREY appeared by video means with Attorney.
